title: Rosenberg Asks What Putin Hopes to Achieve With a Three-Day Ceasefire
summary: In May, Russian President Vladimir Putin initiated a three-day ceasefire, coinciding with the 80th anniversary of the end of World War Two. This move, according to reports, suggests a possible strategic maneuver by Putin. The article discusses the potential motivations behind this ceasefire, though specifics are not detailed in the text provided.

title: Houthis Claim Dozens of African Migrants Died in US Strike on Yemen
summary: The Houthis have reported that dozens of African migrants were killed in a strike on a detention center in Saada, Yemen, with 68 bodies recovered thus far. The Houthi-run media attributed the attack to the United States. This incident underscores the dire humanitarian situation in Yemen, exacerbated by ongoing conflict and the presence of a large migrant population seeking passage to other countries. It highlights the complex interplay of migration, conflict, and potential international involvement in the region.

title: Finland's Leader Warns Russia Against Undermining President Trump
text: President Alexander Stubb of Finland, who has become an interlocutor in peace talks, says in an interview he doesn’t want Ukraine to suffer the same fate his country once endured.
summary: Finland's President Alexander Stubb, acting as an informal intermediary in potential peace negotiations, has signaled his desire to prevent Ukraine from experiencing a fate similar to Finland's historical challenges. Stubb's involvement stems from Finland's own experience with Russian aggression, offering him a unique perspective on the conflict. This highlights Finland's commitment to Ukraine's sovereignty and potentially shapes the narrative of future peace talks. While not officially representing any negotiating party, Stubb's sentiments add context to the ongoing international efforts to seek a resolution to the war.

title: Zelensky Dismisses Putin's 72-Hour Truce Offer as Manipulation
text: Russian forces launched 100 attack drones across Ukraine overnight, hours after President Vladimir V. Putin ordered a unilateral three-day cease-fire starting on May 8.
summary: Russian forces disregarded President Vladimir Putin's declared three-day cease-fire, launching a massive drone attack involving 100 unmanned aerial vehicles against Ukraine overnight. This blatant violation of the self-imposed truce demonstrates Russia's continued aggressive posture and undermines any pretense of de-escalation. The attack highlights the ongoing conflict dynamics, where Moscow frequently resorts to unilateral actions, contradicting its stated intentions and further destabilizing the situation in Ukraine. This follows Russia's pattern of asymmetric warfare to target Ukrainian infrastructure and military capabilities, despite facing significant international condemnation.

title: An Attack on a Yemeni Migrant Facility Killed Dozens, According to Houthis and Aid Officials
text: The Houthi militia, which is backed by Iran, said the attack was an American strike. The U.S. Defense Department said it was assessing the claims and took them seriously.
summary: Following a claim by Iran-backed Houthi rebels, the U.S. Defense Department is assessing allegations of an American strike. This development highlights the ongoing tensions in the region and the complex proxy dynamics at play in Yemen. The Houthis' assertion, if confirmed, would represent a direct challenge to U.S. military operations and raise concerns about escalation. The U.S. response, including its assessment of the claims, will be critical in shaping the future of this incident and the broader security landscape.

title: A Russian Missile Destroyed Kyiv Apartments, Shattering a Longstanding Community
text: “It feels like I lost my whole extended family,” one survivor said.
